page.title: 10MUSHROOM FARMING
page.content: Mushrooms are grown in horse manure and straw. The horse manure compost is sterilized at 60 degs. C to kill bacteria harmful to mushrooms and to encourage nutrients. The spawn is cultivated on wheat germ and mixed in with the compost. Every week prepared compost, ready spawned, is delivered to the farm. The compost is put on shelves in a growing room at 25 degs C. After 2 weeks the spawn will have grown through the compost. A layer of peat and crushed limestone is put over the compost. After another week the temperature is lowered to 16 degs C. A week later pin head sized mushrooms appear. They are watered regularly. Two weeks later the first crop is ready. A new crop appears every 7 days. After 6 weeks the compost is removed for use by gardeners. A good yield is 500lb. from 1 ton of compost.
